title: Citt and Bumpkin, or, A learned discourse upon swearing and lying and other laudable qualities tending to a thorow reformation : the second part.
author: L'Estrange, Roger, Sir, 1616-1704.
notes: A reply to Charles Blount's Appeal from the country to the city. Cf. Kitchen, G. Sir Roger L'Estrange, p. 255-256.
Attributed to Sir Roger L'Estrange. Cf. BM.
A first part, Citt and Bumpkin, in a dialogue over a pot of ale, was published earlier the same year.
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
